attraction_reviewComments: Mulholland drive is a must for anybody visiting Los Angeles. The view is amazing, as you can see greater L.A. from a different point of view.
Big houses and great views at some points so it's hard not to enjoy this drive. Most celebrity tours will do part of it but we enjoyed driving the whole length of it and urge... read more

I live in flat, wet Houston so I really enjoyed driving the windy roads and hills along Mulholland. We saw some big houses and the Hollywood sign. Lots of fun things to see in a... read more
It's beautiful and historic, but scary as heck. This is a long winding road often single lane both ways with no shoulder and higher speeds than you would be comfortable with. We... read more
We drove this as a part of our private tour and made stops at several overlooks. While it is indicated as Beverly Hills, some of its best view are of the San Fernando Valley on... read more
These winding roads up in the hills give you some spectacular views of either Downtown or the Valley. There is a small parking lot on one side called the Mulholland Overlook that... read more
go all along the Mulholland Drive, still fascinating

the views on this road are beautiful,no question, but the elevation is scary and the road is so narrow if you have a problem with heights or anything like that it may be a... read more
Take your date and park. See the beautiful lights of the San Fernando Valley for free. Road is curvy and exciting. You could bring a picnic and park. From Laurel Canyon to... read more
Nice views of the LA from up high without a long drive
Long and littered with famous homes. Must see if you are intrigued by Hollywood. A few movies made about this place making it all the more must see. Not a bad thing to visit... read more
I absolutely love Mulholland Drive and often, to clear my head, I'll take a detour up there. Early in the morning on the way to Runyon Canyon to walk the dog I'll sometimes see... read more
Great drive and view of the city. My first time was in a little convertible on a beautiful day. Just watch where you are going. ;)
We started our drive along Mulholland drive in Encino and went east along some overlooks and stopped at some of them. At the last one you're not that far away from the... read more
For Michael Connelly fans, Mulholland Drive is a must, as many of his Harry Bosch and Lincoln Lawyer series novels are based at or near Mulholland Drive. Seeing the locations... read more
I dont know what else to say... it takes some effort to get up and drive the entire expanse of this road but everything thats great takes time.
I've commuted on this road at times. Doesn't matter if it's day or night, the views are always spectacular. But it's a dangerous road, lots of hairpin turns -- better for the... read more
I love to drive here and take in the views and the sights. I am a little partial to this drive since I live on it and can take advantage of it's beauty every day!
A drive down Mulholland Drive was included in our Warner Bros and Movie Star Homes Tour. The guide knew of the locations of all the famous residents and also former residents.
You can see the whole city from up here and the drive is amazing. Just to think so many famous people did the same drive WOW.
This was on our must do list for our trip up the CA coast. We took a ride on the windy road and stopped at the over looks to take pics of LA and Hollywood. It was worth the trip!!
You get a great feel for the area on this drive. Still looking for the kids selling maps from the Bad News Bears:) Give you a good idea of the opulence here
This is a fun drive on a fall or winter day, especially if you have a convertible. You can gawk at the over-the-top homes and on a clear day the views are magnificent.
A must do when in L.A. Plenty of spots to stop and see the views. Don't try to look while driving as the road is very windy and narrow in some areas.
Driving along Mulholland Drive is a must for a visit to LA. Some of the views are amazing and it's also a pretty convenient (lighter traffic) route across town. It may not be... read more
When in the LA area, one of the must do things is to take a drive up Mulholland Drive and look down over the LA basin. It is really a beautiful view.
Aside from touring the ghosts of hollywood past the view along the ridge is fantastic. Well worth the effort
What a great drive, what a lovely, peaceful atmosphere ! Rinse your eyes with flowers and trees, beautiful houses, amazing architectural styles, winding roads, ENJOY and stop... read more
I recommend driving there twice, once in day light and once at dawn. You will experience priceless views.
One of the best places to stop by at when visiting the Los Angeles area. The place we stopped at gave us a view of Burbank and Universal City. We were there around 2 AM so there... read more
you need to drive on this road. lined with the nicest designed houses on both sides, you get to see the beverly hills life! there are some really awesome look out points. we... read more
Unbelievable views of the city! The view points to stop at are just amazing! You get so many beautiful views of the city along this drive. An absolute must when visiting LA
Went on my honeymoon, beautiful place to visit at Hollywood. Great drive and an awesome view. Enjoy some fantastic views of Los Angeles and beyond to take great pictures.
I've always been the driver rather than the passenger when driving Mulholland so I cannot comment directly on the views, but judging from passengers' reactions, it is awesome... read more
The views - allow time as its slow driving plus you want to see the city from up here. We also took in the observatory on the same trip out.
We went on one of those Hollywood homes tours so naturally we ended up on Mulholland Drive. It was interesting to see where certain celebrities lived. A few days after the tour... read more
Love sight seeing here and seeing all of the beautiful homes, parks and neighborhood. Wishing we could live there.
There is no other better way then to drive Mulholland to get a feel for LA. Stop and make a wish….dreams really do come true in the City of Angels.
It takes about an hour to drive down the road. It is less busy and less well-known than Sunset Boulevard, but the scenery is equally pretty, with a very nice area, many pretty... read more
Breath taking views (when not interfered by the fog). The Perfect getaway when visiting Los Angeles, CA

Magnificent point of view of the different neighbourhoods of the greater LA. It is a windy road with many luxury villas around. We joined it at Cahuenga Blvd W. intersection right... read more
Lovely views of downtown, Hollywood sign, universal city, and Hollywood Bowl. Would have loved to have driven further up, but ran out of time.

enrich_metadata.label: Beverly Hills, California
enrich_metadata.mention_address: Beverly Hills, Los Angeles County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.abstract: Beverly Hills is a city in Los Angeles County, California, United States, surrounded by the cities of Los Angeles and West Hollywood. Originally a Spanish ranch where lima beans were grown, Beverly Hills was incorporated in 1914 by a group of investors who had failed to find oil, but found water instead and eventually decided to develop it into a town. By 2013, its population had grown to 34,658. Sometimes referred to as "90210", one of its primary ZIP codes, it is home to many actors and celebrities. The city includes the Rodeo Drive shopping district and the Beverly Hills Oil Field.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Beverly_Hills,_California

Originally a Spanish ranch where lima beans were grown, Beverly Hills was incorporated in 1914 by a group of investors who had failed to find oil, but found water instead and eventually decided to develop it into a town. By 2013, its population had grown to 34,658. Sometimes referred to as "90210", one of its primary ZIP codes, it is home to many actors and celebrities. The city includes the Rodeo Drive shopping district and the Beverly Hills Oil Field.

enrich_metadata.label: Inglewood, California
enrich_metadata.abstract: Inglewood is a city in southwestern Los Angeles County, California, southwest of downtown Los Angeles. As of the 2010 U.S. Census, the city had a population of 109,673. It was incorporated on February 14, 1908. The city is in the South Bay region of the Greater Los Angeles Area. City of Champions Stadium is under construction in the city and when finished around 2019 will be the home of the Los Angeles Rams, which moved back to the Los Angeles Area in 2016.

attraction_reviewComments: Musicians of all types playing at the pier, with great ocean views, fun games and a variety of food options.

The pier is full of things to see and do. Although it only needs an hour or so to fully explore. It's bustling and lively both day and night. One evening we ate in the Mexican... read more
The pier is kind of fun as you remember your days at amusement parks in iconic America. It's definitely worth the stop and the ferris wheel at sunset if you can make it happen... read more

On the pier are a small amusement park, restaurants, souvenir shops, and a nice view of the ocean. It is really lovely walking up and down the pier, but unless you're into that... read more
Clean & well maintained area Some good rides for the kids Perfect spot for watching the sunset.... Worth a visit

When you're near the beach in Santa Monica, the Pier practically begs you to at least come visit. We did. Several times. It was an alright experience. Not our favorite thing... read more
This is a great place to visit for some old fashioned carnival rides and fun. They have many different rides for young ones as well as adults. You can also play on the beach and... read more
Had a ball! The kids (3 & 6 year old) loved all the rides. I loved the cotton candy and the view!

I had heard that the pier was on the "seedy" side, this is not true at all. I wouldn't drive here from L.A. but if you are already in Santa Monica, it is a nice walk out to the... read more
Went to the pier to take a look around, all sorts of interesting "characters" there. Lots of activity and people milling about, vendors of every variety hawking their... read more
It's fun - but it's no more than a pier. A sea of tourists and plenty of stalls to sell touristy things. It's the end of the Route 66 trail and that's interesting but there didn't... read more
We had such a beautiful day in Santa Monica, the pier just beckoned to us, so it was our first stop. There are lots of vendors,street performers and restaurants along the pier... read more
A lovely Pier to walk to and if lucky to go on the rides if they are open.There was a man singing at the end of the Pier he was really good we sat and listened and watched the... read more

From the welcome sign on Colorado to the end, the pier is full of sights, sounds, and yes, smells (mostly food).
Enjoy the view,play games eat snacks,watch the trapeze school or participate.Goon the Ferris wheel and the ride bicycles on the bike path along the beach to Venice!
We enjoyed walking down the pier. My son rode a couple of the rides. The view is beautiful, especially at sunset.
A 20 minute walk. A gaming arcade and some fairground rides to go on. Basic really.

Take a walk out to the end of the pier. Cute shop about Rt 66 and a great view of the beach. Perfect spot to take photos
Never been to a pier before so we thought this was great. Love the ocean waves crashing in.
The pier is interesting. You can either go in the arena and play video games, or walk around or take a ride..or rent a bike and bike to Venice. Fun place. Gets foggy in the winter.
great little stop over walk out to the end of the pier and enjoy the view of santa monica bay easy in and out

enrich_metadata.label: Beverly Hills, California
enrich_metadata.abstract: Beverly Hills is a city in Los Angeles County, California, United States, surrounded by the cities of Los Angeles and West Hollywood. Originally a Spanish ranch where lima beans were grown, Beverly Hills was incorporated in 1914 by a group of investors who had failed to find oil, but found water instead and eventually decided to develop it into a town. By 2013, its population had grown to 34,658. Sometimes referred to as "90210", one of its primary ZIP codes, it is home to many actors and celebrities. The city includes the Rodeo Drive shopping district and the Beverly Hills Oil Field.

By 2013, its population had grown to 34,658. Sometimes referred to as "90210", one of its primary ZIP codes, it is home to many actors and celebrities. The city includes the Rodeo Drive shopping district and the Beverly Hills Oil Field.

live music, good food, and good shopping/browsing... great place to take guests new to LA

Just saw they're going to do free Shakespeare at the Pico House (next to main plaza) again this summer. Saw Twelfth Night there with friends last summer, and it was great. This... read more

Fried chicken tacos at the little "comedores" are so authentic and delicios. If you vist Olvera street try the fried tacos at one of the little eating places not restaurants. They... read more

Its a cute little mexican area where you can buy mexican stuff and get mexican goods and snacks and mexican history i went once no need to go back again you can see it all in... read more

An interesting visit. Beautiful old houses and the museum but (as others have noted) a bit of a tourist trap...
this place is just fun. a little touristy and kind of overpriced by plain fun. good margaritas and lots of mexican food to eat. lots of other authentic gifts for christmas and... read more

Historical, fun, cheap shopping, decent food. You can take the Gold Line to Union Station and then walk across the street. A great day outing for a couple or a family.
This is old Los Angeles. Many eating establishments along this stretch of Olvera Street. Very casual attire and lots of places to shop for Mexican products. Toys for the kids... read more
The shops and stands offered so much it was hard to choose things to bring back home. Great restaurants where I had the BEST margarita.

Even though I live in L.A. A trip to Olvera Street is a nice way to spend the afternoon. Eating in one of the several Mexican Restaurants is like being in a clean safe Mexico with... read more
A close encounter with the Hispanic culture and their things without going over the border. It is always exciting to experience the music, dances and food of this ethnic group.

Very interesting slice of Mexico in the middle of Los Angels. A reminder of the California heritage.

It's an interesting place to see and has a bunch of history associated with it but it's a tourist high-point and not really much more. Worth seeing quickly
A very small area, compared to what it used to be. Sad, because it used to be something of a landmark for SoCal's rich Spanish heritage. Still a couple of good restaurants here... read more
Colourful little street, loaded with colourful little shops and cafes. Good to fill in a day while in the Downtown area. I enjoyed it.

enrich_metadata.label: Burbank, California
enrich_metadata.mention_address: Burbank, Los Angeles County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.abstract: Burbank is a city in Los Angeles County in Southern California, United States, 12 miles (19 km) northwest of downtown Los Angeles. The population at the 2010 census was 103,340. Billed as the "Media Capital of the World" and only a few miles northeast of Hollywood, numerous media and entertainment companies are headquartered or have significant production facilities in Burbank, including The Walt Disney Company, Warner Bros. Entertainment, ABC Studios, ABC Family, Marvel Studios, Nickelodeon, NBC, and Insomniac Games. The city is also home to Bob Hope Airport. Burbank also holds a special place in aerospace history since Lockheed's Skunk Works in Burbank produced some of the most secret and technologically advanced airplanes, including the U-2 spy planes that uncovered the Soviet Union missile components in Cuba. Burbank consists of two distinct areas: a downtown, in the foothills of the Verdugo Mountains, and flatlands, at the east end of the San Fernando Valley. At one time, it was referred to as "Beautiful Downtown Burbank" on Laugh-In and The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson. The city was named after David Burbank, a New Hampshire-born dentist and entrepreneur.

enrich_metadata.label: Sierra Madre, California
enrich_metadata.abstract: Sierra Madre is a city in Los Angeles County, California whose population was 10,917 at the 2010 U.S. Census, up from 10,580 at the time of the 2000 U.S. Census. The city is located in the foothills of the San Gabriel Valley below the southern edge of the Angeles National Forest. Pasadena and Altadena are to its west, with Arcadia to its south and east. Sierra Madre is known as "Wisteria City", and its city seal is decorated with a drawing of the now widely known 500-foot (150 m) vine. It is also called the "Village of the Foothills" and was an All-America City in 2007.

enrich_metadata.abstract: Monrovia is a city located in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains in the San Gabriel Valley of Los Angeles County, California, United States. The population was 36,590 at the 2010 census, down from 36,929 in 2000. Monrovia has been used for filming TV shows, movies and commercials.
